synopses.synopsis: Good News of 1938 was announced as the most spectacular radio show ever launched, though the finished product fell somewhat short of preshow hyperbole. It did, as Newsweek pointed out, mark the 'first major collaboration of a movie studio and a broadcasting system in behalf of a commercial sponsor.' - On the Air: The Encyclopedia of Old-Time Radio by John Dunning
